## Data

```{r}
library(EpiBayes)
data("EuropeCovid")
args <- EuropeCovid
```

Pick out two countries as example
```{r}
w <- data$country %in% c("United_Kingdom","Germany")
data <- data[w,]
args$data <- data
```

Add days to the covariates
```{r}
args$data$day <- as.integer(args$data$date-min(args$data$date))
```

Set sampling parameters.
```{r}
args$algorithm <- "sampling"
options(mc.cores = parallel::detectCores())
args$iter=100
```

### Piecewise constant

```{r}
args$formula <- R(country,date) ~ 0 +  (cut(day,c(-1,30,45,60,100))|country)
```

```{r,results='hide'}
fit <- do.call("epim", args)
```

```{r}
plot_rt(fit, "United_Kingdom")
```



### Piecewise Linear


```{r}
args$formula <- R(country,date) ~ 0 +  (bs(day,knots=c(30,45,60),degree=1,intercept=TRUE)|country)
```

```{r,results='hide'}
fit <- do.call("epim", args)
```

```{r}
plot_rt(fit, "United_Kingdom")
```


### Quadratic


```{r}
args$formula <- R(country,date) ~ 0 +  (bs(day,knots=c(30,45,60),degree=2)|country)
```

```{r,results='hide'}
fit <- do.call("epim", args)
```

```{r}
plot_rt(fit, "United_Kingdom")
```
